alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 27 at 3:03PM AKST until January 29 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SUNDAY TO 7 PM AKST MONDAY FOR THE SOUTHERN COPPER RIVER BASIN... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 25 to 50 inches. * WHERE...Southern Copper River Basin, Edgerton Highway and Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. * WHEN...From 1 AM Sunday to 7 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to move into the Copper River Basin as early as this evening, remaining relatively light, and then increase in intensity into the overnight hours tonight. This is expected to be a long duration event persisting into Tuesday at least. Sunday night through Monday morning are going to see up to a foot of snow possible during a 12-hr period, and up to 50 inches of new snow accumulation possible near the Chugach Mountains. Highest total snow amounts will be along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina, with total snow amounts along the Edgerton Highway receiving up to 25 inches. Areas further north between Glennallen and Paxson may see up to 6 inches of new snow.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
